note.title: Security Awareness Training
note.content:
## ğŸ” Security Awareness Training
Security awareness helps employees recognize threats, reduce risky behavior, and protect organizational data.

### ğŸ£ Phishing Awareness
- Beware of urgency, unusual requests, mismatched URLs, and poor grammar.
- Always verify sender addresses.
- Report suspicious messages to the security team.

### ğŸ‘¤ Anomalous & Risky Behavior
- **Risky:** Installing unauthorized software, clicking unknown links.
- **Unexpected:** Logins from unusual times/locations.
- **Unintentional:** Sending data to the wrong recipient.

### ğŸ›¡ï¸ User Guidance
- Follow company policies and handbooks.
- Maintain situational awareness (e.g., shoulder surfing, tailgating).
- Use password managers to store credentials securely.

### â˜¢ï¸ Insider Threat Basics
Threats can come from internal users due to negligence or malicious intent.

### ğŸ’¾ Removable Media Safety
Never plug in unknown USB drives â€” may contain malware.

### ğŸ§  Social Engineering Cues
Attackers exploit:
- **Authority**
- **Urgency**
- **Social Proof**
- **Scarcity**
- **Likability**
- **Fear**

### ğŸŒ Remote & Hybrid Work
- Use VPNs and MFA.
- Keep company devices updated.
- Use secure collaboration tools.

### ğŸ“Š Reporting & Training Cycle
- **Initial:** Onboarding security training.
- **Recurring:** Periodic refreshers.
- **Execution:** Campaigns, simulations, and continuous monitoring.

sourceNote.title: CompTIA Security+
sourceNote.content:
### ğŸ›¡ï¸ CompTIA Security+ (SY0-701)
#### ğŸ“… Exam Date: September 7, 2025
#### â³ Study Duration: About 1.5 months
#### ğŸ“„ Study Notes
[Download Security+ Study Notes PDF](/pdf/CompTIA Security+.pdf)

### â­ Why I Pursued Security+
CompTIA Security+ was my first step into building a strong cybersecurity foundation. I used it to learn core security concepts, and strengthen my knowledge for future internships.

### ğŸ“˜ Key Domains & Important Topics
 Below are the most valuable Security+ topics. Many link to deeper notes. 
#### ğŸ” Domain 1 â€” General Security Concepts
- [[CIA Triad]] 
- [[Security Controls]] 
- [[Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA)]] 
- [[Zero Trust Model]] 
- [[PKI & Encryption]] 
#### ğŸ§ª Domain 2 â€” Threats, Vulnerabilities & Mitigations 
- [[Common Threat Actors]] 
- [[Social Engineering]] 
- [[Malware Types]] 
- [[Vulnerability Types]] 
#### ğŸŒ Domain 3 â€” Security Architecture 
- [[Defense in Depth]] 
- [[Secure Network Segmentation]] 
- [[Data Protection]] 
#### ğŸ–¥ï¸ Domain 4 â€” Security Operations 
- [[Secure Baselines & Hardening]] 
- [[Vulnerability Management Lifecycle]] 
- [[Identity and Access Management (IAM)]] 
- [[Incident Response Process]]
#### âš™ï¸ Domain 5 â€” Security Program Management and Oversight 
- [[Security Policies]] 
- [[Risk Management]] 
- [[Audits & Assessments]] 
- [[Security Awareness Training]] 

### ğŸ§° Resources
#### ğŸ¥ Video Courses
- Jason Dion â€“ CompTIA Security+ Full Course (Udemy)
- CyberCraft â€“ Security+ PBQ Playlist (YouTube)
- Cyber James â€“ Security+ Practice Test Videos (YouTube)
#### ğŸ“˜ Practice Exams
- Jason Dion â€“ Practice Exam Sets (Udemy)
- ExamCompass Security+ Practice Tests
- TechExam.pro â€“ Security+ Full Practice Exams 
### ğŸ›£ï¸ My Personal Tips  
 1. **Understand concepts, donâ€™t memorize answers.** 
 2. **Do 500â€“700 practice questions minimum.** 
 3. **Use multiple sources, not one.**
